column1: https://www.24mantra.com/blogs/organic-food/include-roasted-chana-bengal-gram-dal-in-your-diet-plan-today/,Include Roasted Chana Bengal Gram Dal In Your Diet Plan today!- 24 Mantra Organic,"<div class=""about-blog"">

Roasted chana (also known as Roasted Chana Bengal Gram Dal) is a superfood that is loaded with immense health benefitting properties. Not only is it low on calories, but the attractive nutrient profile of roasted chana can make it an effective diet constituent of almost any diet plan.

Roasted chana or bhuna chana is one of the most popular snack items in North India. It is best consumed with the outer layer intact that have an enormous amount of fibre and protein, that take longer to digest and keep you full for longer.

If you are struggling with those extra kilos, it’s imperative that you choose roasted chana for weight loss as it is highly rich in protein and fibre content. It is one of the best food items that you can include in your diet to reduce your overall calorie intake.
Before we analyse how beneficial is roasted chana for weight loss, let’s have a look at the nutrient profile of this superfood.

Roasted chana is one of the healthy snacks that you can put in your body. It’s high fibre and high protein content keeps you full for longer as they take longer to get digested in your body. It’s fulfilling nature can help you avoid those snacking cravings and avoid those excess calories. Below is a table representing the nutrient profile of roasted chana as provided by FatSecret.
A 100g serving of roasted chana provides about 18.64g of protein and 16.8g of fibre that is a sufficiently high amount to put your snacking cravings at bay and build a healthy body.
If you are struggling with your weight and looking for a healthy food item to include in your daily diet, it is suggested that you regularly consume roasted chana for weight loss.
Now that you are aware of the roasted chana nutritional profile, it’s time to look at a few roasted chana benefits.

Aside from the benefits of roasted chana for weight loss, there are numerous other benefits of roasted chana as well. The nutrition profile has already shown us how rich is it in its protein and fibre content, but there are numerous other roasted chana benefits that we will explore further in this post.

• Improves digestive health: It is highly beneficial to consume roasted chana for weight loss, owing to its rich fibre content, but this fibre is immensely useful in maintaining a healthy digestive system. According to a study published by the NCBI, the dietary fibre is not digested in the stomach and helps in moving the ingested food seamlessly. This prevents you from feeling bloated or constipated. It also hardens the stool to facilitate an easy bowel movement.

• It is good for cardiac health: Roasted chana is an excellent source of trace elements such as manganese, folate, phosphorus and copper whose benefits include a reduction in risk of cardiovascular disease, as per a report published on the NCBI. These elements assist the body in performing various functions as well as strengthening the immune system.

• It is suitable for diabetics: Aside from the benefits of roasted chana for weight loss, diabetics, too, would be surprised to know that roasted chana has one of the lowest GIs of any food item. According to a report published by the NCBI, intake of low GI foods has been linked to minimising the glucose fluctuations in your body that plague diabetics. Moreover, the low glucose levels in your body protect you from sugar crashes and help you in staying alert.

• An excellent source of protein: Roasted chana can prove to be an effective protein source for vegans who find it difficult to incorporate protein-rich food constituents in their everyday diet. According to a study published on NCBI, sufficient protein intake has been linked to having a positive impact on your weight loss strategy, which makes it excellent to opt for roasted chana for weight loss.

• Helps in building healthy bones: Roasted chana is an excellent source of crucial elements that help your body in maintaining healthy bones and preventing a host of diseases. According to a study published by the NCBI, the copper, manganese, and phosphorus present in roasted chana help your body in maintaining healthy bone health and preventing diseases such as abnormal bone formations, skeletal fragility, joint pains, etc.

• Helps in regulating blood pressure: The phosphorus present in roasted chana helps in regulating blood pressure and maintaining healthy cardiovascular health. According to a PubMed report, greater phosphorus intake plays a key role in reducing the blood pressure of your body. Moreover, phosphorus plays a key role in several biological processes happening in your body.

• Reduces the risk of a few types of cancers: Roasted chana is a rich source of selenium that is a powerful antioxidant. A study published on PubMed explored the benefits of selenium and concluded that selenium capability to reduce DNA damage and enhance the immunity of individuals can prove to be effective in reducing the risk of a few types of cancers.

Aside from these, there are numerous other benefits of consuming roasted chana for weight loss. If you were considering consuming roasted chana for weight loss, now you have a host of reasons to incorporate this superfood into your everyday diet.

If you are in the market for buying roasted chana, it would be best if you opt for the organic variety. This ensures that the product is free from harmful pesticides, non-GMO, and is usually fresher than its non- organic counterparts.

As you can see, aside from the benefits of roasted chana for weight loss, there are numerous other benefits of this superfood that make it a perfect addition to any health-conscious diet plan. Roasted chana can be purchased easily in the market and is immensely healthy for people of any age group.

https://www.24mantra.com/blogs/health-and-nutrition/top-x-vitamin-b12-foods-for-vegetarians/,List of 10Vitamin B12 foods for Vegetarians - 24 Mantra Organic,"<div class=""about-blog"">

Vitamin B12 is essential for our body because it helps in the working of our nervous systems and for proper growth and development. Issues like loss of weight, anaemia, and constipation are sometimes due to deficiency of Vitamin B12 in your body. Usually, the risks of developing these problems are more in vegetarian people because Vitamin B12 is naturally available in animals.

Most of you don’t know that there is a huge list of Vitamin B12 foods for vegetarians as well. Some of the classic examples of vegan foods fortified with vitamin B12 are milk, yoghurt, tofu, juices, cheese, etc.
Before discussing the top foods containing Vitamin B12, let’s check why this vitamin is important for our body.

Vitamin B12 is an essential nutrient needed by your body for proper functioning, and therefore, it’s important to consume foods that are rich in this vitamin. You may start to develop one of the following symptoms due to the deficiency of Vitamin B12.

One of the serious consequences of Vitamin B12 is pernicious anaemia. To prevent these problems, it’s important to consume foods that are rich sources of Vitamin B12. In this context, you’ll get to know the top Vitamin B12 Foods for Vegetarians. Though vegans have limited food options, they can still manage to include some of the organic food items in their diet. The daily recommended value for adults is 2.4 micrograms.

Most of you don’t know that there are several Vitamin B12 foods for vegetarians. It is not just restricted to eggs or chicken but also has varieties of vegan options. In this table below, you’ll find which vegan foods offer how much percentage of your Daily Value of Vitamin B12.
• Milk– Milk contains Vitamin B12 and is an excellent source of calcium. You can have low fat or skimmed milk. To enhance the taste, you can add protein powders or other flavours to it.

• Cheese– This is one of the delicious food choices that you can have. It contains Vitamin B12. Having cheese in the right quantities can provide the essential vitamins needed by your body. You have lots of options to choose from- Feta cheese, parmesan cheese, and Mozzarella cheese. This is one of the best Vitamin B12 foods for vegetarians.

• Yoghurt– Including a bowl of yoghurt with your lunch or dinner can provide you sufficient amount of Vitamin B12. Add sugar or salt to enhance the taste, or you may have it even without adding anything. The choice is yours.
• Swiss cheese– It offers 14-15% of the nutrient requirements. Add fruits or veggies along with it to have a nutritious and fibre-rich diet.

• Vegetables– Usually, most vegetables contain some amount of Vitamin B12, but there are some Vitamin B12 foods for vegetarians that contain a very high amount of Vitamin B12 namely- Spinach, Beetroot, Potatoes, Mushrooms, alfalfa, and others.
• Fruits– Though fruits don’t contain Vitamin B12
column2: there are some which contain a very small amount of these vitamins like- Banana, apple, and berries. Just because it does not have vitamin B12 does not mean that you won’t include them in your diet. Having fruits in between meals can be a good choice to increase your daily nutrition requirements. Fruits are important not only for vitamins but also for getting other essential nutrients.

column1: • Fortified cereals– Having a bowl of fortified cereal for your breakfast can be a good option for including Vitamin B12 in your diet. This is one of the phenomenal Vitamin B12 foods for vegetarians. Some examples of these cereals include- Oat bran flakes, Cornflakes, etc.

• Yeast– For Vegans, this is a phenomenal choice to incorporate Vitamin B12 in their diet. 100 grams of Yeast delivers 7-8% of your daily vitamin requirements. You can have this along with popcorn or nachos. It is also a great addition to salads.

• Tofu– Have you heard about soya Paneer? Yes! That is exactly what tofu is. This vegan food is rich in Vitamin B12 and is also known as Bean curd. You can have it with chapattis or rice. Or you can also sauté it in oil and mix with salad.

• Nori– Usually, this falls under the category red algae genus Pyropia and is a sea vegetable. The best thing about this vitamin b12 source is that it has a strong aroma and is mainly used in Japanese preparations like Sushi. You can also use this edible seaweed on top of soups or noodles. This is delicious Vitamin B12 foods for vegetarians.

These are some of the Vitamin B12 foods for vegetarians that you can incorporate into your diet. To conclude, Vitamin B12 is very important for your body and its deficiency can cause several health issues.

Usually, Vitamin B12 is naturally found in eggs, fish, meat, and other animal sources. But when it comes to vegan options, you don’t have much choice. By incorporating the foods mentioned above, you can fulfil your daily requirements.
Also, always opt for organic foods because they are made without any harmful chemicals. Thus they are 100% natural and have no water retention.

https://www.24mantra.com/blogs/health-and-nutrition/green-moong-dals-nutritional-value-per-100g-8-health-facts/,8 Health Facts & Nutritional Value About Green Moong Dal | 24 Mantra,"<div class=""about-blog"">

From a simple khichdi to crispy fried fritters, green moong dal can be used in so many mouth-watering recipes. The green moong dal (moong dal chilka) is a staple that can be found in every Indian kitchen. The country is the largest producer and consumer of green moong dal in the world. When the moong bean is split into two halves, it is known as moong dal.
Are you wondering about green moong dal’s nutritional value per 100g? Read on to know more.
Here’s green moong dal’s nutritional value per 100g:
Now that we know about green moong dal’s nutritional value per 100g, let’s know some interesting facts about this delicious pulse.
1. It can help you lose weight:

Really low in calories, with almost no fat (just 1g – refer the green moong dal’s nutritional value per 100g table), green moong dal is ideal for those who want to lose weight. It is nutritious, healthy and won’t make you feel guilty about what you ate. If you are on a diet, include this in your meals.
2. It is good for heart health:

Along with containing a good amount of potassium, green moong dal is also cholesterol-free. Both of these factors help in improving heart health. A study published in ‘The Lancet‘ journal found that there is a link between elevated non-HDL cholesterol levels and long-term cardiovascular risk.
3. It works wonders for your muscles:

According to Harvard Medical School, potassium not only helps with the heart but is also essential for nerve and muscle functioning. A study in the journal ‘Nutrients’ also stated how protein is beneficial for muscle mass. Green moong dal contains 8 grams of protein.
4. It is a great source of fibre:

The USDA recommends that women up to the age of 50 should consume 25 grams a day while men should have 38 grams a day. For those below 50, it is 21 grams for women and 30 for men. As we saw in the green moong dal’s nutritional value per 100g table, it contains 8g of dietary fibre. This makes up about 30-35% of the daily recommended value. Eating sufficient fibre can aid in better digestion and prevent constipation.
5. It will not spike your blood sugar and is safe for diabetics:
Green moong dal contains only 2.9 grams of sugars (it is safe to consume about 25 grams for women and 38 grams for men, according to AHA). Low amounts of sugar make it safe to consume for diabetics.
6. It makes up for 8% of the recommended daily iron intake:

Iron is essential for the human body. It is responsible for oxygen transport, metabolic processes, electron transport, DNA synthesis and more. Green moong dal proves to be a good source of iron. The ‘Journal of Research in Medical Sciences’ also supports this.
7. It has antioxidant properties and can help with disease prevention:

The Vitamin C provides for 3.4% of the daily intake value as we saw in green moong dal’s nutritional value per 100g facts. It has several benefits for health. A study published in the ‘Indian Journal of Clinical Biochemistry‘ states that the vitamin is essential for connective tissues, bone formation, wound healing, healthy gums, metabolic functions, the immune system and more. It is an antioxidant and works as a therapeutic agent in many diseases.
8. It provides for 3.4% of daily Vitamin A value:

The National Institutes of Health states that Vitamin A is crucial for the functioning of various organs like the heart, the lungs and the kidneys. It is also important for normal vision, reproduction and the immune system. Moong dal’s nutritional value is higher because of the presence of this vitamin.
Green Moong Dal: A Way to a Healthy You

Green moong dal’s nutritional value per 100g shows how good it is for our health. It’s an interesting fact to note that moong, from which we get the moong dal, could have been domesticated as early as 2000 BC in India, according to a study published in the ‘Annals of Botany’!

A mix of vitamins, minerals and more, moong dal has survived the test of time. Add it to your meal to give your body some essential nutrients. Whip something tasty up today! Green moong dal is a way to make your tastebuds and your health happy. It’s a win-win situation.
